Matrix to convert 5 Doodson arguments (without GMST) to Delaunay arguments. For order:
calculateDoodsonFundamentalArguments
calculateDelaunayFundamentalArguments

Matrix to convert delaunay arguments to 5 Doodson arguments (without GMST). For order:
calculateDoodsonFundamentalArguments
calculateDelaunayFundamentalArguments

memberdef.argsstring: (const double terrestrialTime, const double referenceJulianDay=basic_astrodynamics::JULIAN_DAY_ON_J2000, const basic_astrodynamics::IAUConventions precessionNutationTheory=basic_astrodynamics::iau_2000_b)
memberdef.name: getPositionOfCipInGcrs

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate CIP and CIO locator according to requested IAU conventions.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate CIP (Celestial Intermediate Pole, typically denoted as X and Y) and CIO locator (Celestial Intermediate Origin, typically denoted s) according to requested IAU conventions using Sofa implementation. See Petit et al. (2010), chap. 5 for more details on requested variables. Note that this function does not include empirical corrections, published as daily values by the IERS.
terrestrialTime
Time in TT in seconds since referenceJulianDay julianDay.
referenceJulianDay
Julian day wrt which tt is referenced (default = J2000)
precessionNutationTheory
IAU conventions that are to be used for calculation (i.e. determining which Sofa function to call)
Pair of first: Vector of entries X, Y (in that order) CIP values and second: CIO locator.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double terrestrialTime, const double universalTime1, const double referenceJulianDay=basic_astrodynamics::JULIAN_DAY_ON_J2000, const basic_astrodynamics::IAUConventions iauConvention=basic_astrodynamics::iau_2000_b)
memberdef.name: calculateGreenwichMeanSiderealTime

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate GMST according to requested IAU conventions.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate GMST (Greenwich Mean Sidereal Time) according to requested IAU conventions using Sofa implementation. Note that this function does not include empirical corrections, as published as daily values by IERS.
terrestrialTime
Time in TT in seconds since reference julian day.
universalTime1
Time in UT1 in seconds since reference julian day.
referenceJulianDay
Julian day wrt which input times are referenced (default = J2000)
iauConvention
IAU conventions that are to be used for calculation (i.e. determining which Sofa function to call)
Current GMST (normalized to [0,2 pi]).

memberdef.argsstring: (const double terrestrialTime, const double referenceJulianDay=basic_astrodynamics::JULIAN_DAY_ON_J2000, const basic_astrodynamics::IAUConventions iauConvention=basic_astrodynamics::iau_2000_b)
memberdef.name: calculateEquationOfEquinoxes

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the equation of equinoxes at the given epoch according to requested IAU conventions.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the equation of equinoxes at the given epoch according to requested IAU conventions using a SOFA implementation. This equation gives the angular difference between the mean and true equinox of date. This can in turn be used to e.g. convert GMST to GAST (and vice versa) or convert a state in the TEME frame to the TOD frame.
terrestrialTime
Time in TT in seconds since reference julian day.
referenceJulianDay
Julian day wrt which input times are referenced (default = J2000).
iauConvention
IAU conventions that are to be used for calculation (i.e. determining which Sofa function to call).
Equation of equinoxes (in radians).

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the combined precession/nutation rotation matrix to go from the GCRF to the True Of Date (TOD) frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the rotation matrix incorporating the combined effect of nutation and precession, based on the 1976 and 1980 IAU models. It is a function of the epoch that is the argument of this function. Since Tudat usually works with times measured from J2000, it is normally sufficient to provide the first argument only, containing the number of seconds terrestrial time since the J2000 epoch. If a different reference epoch is desired, it is mandatory to provide this epoch as a Julian day as the second argument.
terrestrialTime
Epoch in seconds since the reference epoch at which the precession/nutation rotation matrix is to be retrieved from SOFA.
referenceJulianDay
Julian Day (JD) of the reference epoch from which the terrestrial time argument is measured.
Eigen rotation matrix that can be used to rotate 3D vectors (position or velocity) from the J2000 to the True Of Date frame.

memberdef.argsstring: (double &zeta, double &z, double &theta, const double terrestrialTime, const double referenceJulianDay=basic_astrodynamics::JULIAN_DAY_ON_J2000)
memberdef.name: getPrecessionAngles

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the IAU-1976 precession model angles zeta, z, and theta.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to retrieve the IAU-1976 precession model angles zeta, z, and theta. These angles embody the transformation from the Mean-Of-Date frame to the GCRF frame. The definition of these angles can be found on pages 226 to 228 in Vallado (2013).
zeta
Precession angle zeta (third rotation; about z-axis).
z
Precession angle z (first rotation, about z-axis).
theta
Precession angle Theta (second rotation, about y-axis).
terrestrialTime
Epoch in seconds since reference day at which the angles are to be retrieved from SOFA.
referenceJulianDay
Reference epoch for the former parameter, given in Julian Days (default = J2000).

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate ERA (earth rotation angle)

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate ERA (earth rotation angle) from current UT1. The ERA represents one of the Euler angles (between CIO and TIO) for transforming from ITRS to GCRS, see Petit et al. chap. 5
ut1
Time in UT1 in seconds since referenceJulianDay julianDay.
referenceJulianDay
Julian day wrt which ut1 is referenced (default = J2000)
Current Earth rotation angle (normalized to [0,2 pi]).

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate ERA (earth rotation angle) in templated precision.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate ERA (earth rotation angle) from current UT1 in templated precision. The ERA represents one of the Euler angles (between CIO and TIO) for transforming from ITRS to GCRS, see Petit et al. chap. 5
currentUt1
Time in UT1
Current Earth rotation angle (normalized to [0,2 pi]).

julianDaysSinceReference
Days since reference epoch at which the frame bias is to be determined
precessionNutationTheory

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments at the requested time.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. Using the typical notation of the angles, the output order is: l, l', F, D, Omega.
tdbTime
Time in TDB at which the arguments are to be calculated.
Delaunay fundamental arguments at the requested time.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double tdbTime, const double terrestrialTime, const double universalTime1)
memberdef.name: calculateDelaunayFundamentalArgumentsWithGmst

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. Using the typical notation of the angles, the output order is: (GMST + pi), l, l', F, D, Omega. We stress that the first argument is GMST with a 180 degree phase shift
tdbTime
Time in TDB at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
terrestrialTime
Time in TT at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
universalTime1
Time in UT1 at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time.

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. When using this function, TT and TDB are assumed equal, as are UTC and UT1, for the purposes of calculating GMST (which requires TT and UT1). Using the typical notation of the angles, the output order is: (GMST + pi), l, l', F, D, Omega. We stress that the first argument is GMST with a 180 degree phase shift
tdbTime
Time in TDB at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double tdbTime, const double terrestrialTime, const double universalTime1)
memberdef.name: calculateDoodsonFundamentalArguments

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the Doodson arguments at the requested time.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the Doodson arguments at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. Using the typical notation of the angles, the output order is: (GMST + pi - s), s, h, p, N', p_{s}.
tdbTime
Time in TDB at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
terrestrialTime
Time in TT at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
universalTime1
Time in UT1 at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
Doodson arguments and at the requested time.

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the Doodson arguments at the requested time.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the Doodson arguments at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. he Delaunay fundamental arguments and (GMST + pi) at the requested time, using Sofa implementation of angle calculations. When using this function, TT and TDB are assumed equal, as are UTC and UT1, for the purposes of calculating GMST (which requires TT and UT1). Using the typical notation of the angles, the output order is: (GMST + pi - s), s, h, p, N', p_{s}.
tdbTime
Time in TDB at which the arguments are to be calculated, in seconds since J2000.
Doodson arguments and at the requested time.

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate number of leap seconds from UTC input.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate number of leap seconds from UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) input.
utcInJulianDays
Time in UTC; in julianDays since J2000.
Number of leap seconds at requested time.

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate number of leap seconds from TAI input.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate number of leap seconds from UTC (International Atomic Time) input. Note: this function will not work properly near the introduction of a leap second (specifically if TAI is less than the number of leap seconds from the leap second introduction) . In case of incorrect conversion, an error message is produced.
taiInJulianDays
Time in TAI; in seconds since J2000.
Number of leap seconds at requested time.

briefdescription.para: Function to convert TAI to UTC.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert TAI (International Atomic Time) to UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) by subtracting bias ( i.e. number of leap seconds since reference epoch) as determined by Sofa. Note: this function will not work properly near the introduction of a leap second,
getDeltaAtFromTai
taiSeconds
Time in TAI; in seconds since J2000.
Time in UTC; in seconds since J2000

briefdescription.para: Function to convert UTC to TAI.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) to TAI (International Atomic Time) by adding bias (i.e. number of leap seconds since reference epoch) as determined by Sofa.
utcSeconds
Time in UTC; in seconds since J2000
Time in TAI; in seconds since J2000

briefdescription.para: Function to convert TT to UTC.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert TT (Terrestrial Time) to UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) by determining bias (i.e. number of leap seconds since reference epoch and constant bias of TAI wrt TT) as determined by Sofa. Note: this function will not work properly near the introduction of a leap second,
getDeltaAtFromTai
tt
Time in TT; in seconds since J2000
Time in UTC; in seconds since J2000

briefdescription.para: Function to convert UTC to TT.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) to TT (Terrestrial Time) by determining bias (i.e. number of leap seconds since reference epoch and constant bias of TAI wrt TT) as determined by Sofa.
utc
Time in UTC in seconds since J2000
Time in TT; in seconds since J2000

memberdef.argsstring: (const double tdbTime, const double universalTimeFractionOfDay, const double stationLongitude, const double distanceFromSpinAxis, const double distanceFromEquatorialPlane)
memberdef.name: getTDBminusTT

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate difference between TDB and TT.

detaileddescription.para: ! Function to convert UTC to UT1 *!

Function to calculate difference between TDB (Dynamical Barycentric Time) and TT (Terrestrial Time), from Sofa function, which is based on decomposition of time ephemeris generated by Fairhead an Bretagnon (1990). Note that the time ephemeris should be generated by the direct solution of differential equations of proper time using custom ephemerides that, if very high consistency is required.
tdbTime
TDB in seconds since J2000.
universalTimeFractionOfDay
UT1 in fraction of current day.
stationLongitude
Longitude of point on Earth where difference is to be calculated
distanceFromSpinAxis
Distance from Earth spin axis where difference is to be calculated
distanceFromEquatorialPlane
Distance from Earth equatorial plane where difference is to be calculated
Difference between TDB and TT at requested position and TDB

memberdef.argsstring: (const double tdbTime, const double universalTimeFractionOfDay, const Eigen::Vector3d &stationCartesianPosition)
memberdef.name: getTDBminusTT

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate difference between TDB and TT.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate difference between TDB (Dynamical Barycentric Time) and TT (Terrestrial Time), from Sofa function, which is based on decomposition of time ephemeris generated by Fairhead an Bretagnon (1990). Note that the time ephemeris should be generated by the direct solution of differential equations of proper time using custom ephemerides that, if very high consistency is required.
tdbTime
TDB in seconds since J2000.
universalTimeFractionOfDay
UT1 in fraction of current day.
stationCartesianPosition
Earth-fixed Cartesian position of evaluation point
Difference between TDB and TT at requested position and TDB

memberdef.argsstring: (const double ttOrTdbSinceJ2000, const double stationLongitude, const double distanceFromSpinAxis, const double distanceFromEquatorialPlane)
memberdef.name: getTDBminusTT

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate difference between TDB and TT.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate difference between TDB (Dynamical Barycentric Time) and TT (Terrestrial Time), from Sofa function, which is based on decomposition of time ephemeris generated by Fairhead an Bretagnon (1990). This function uses a simplification for the input to the algorithm: it is assumed that UTC and UT1 coincide for the purposes of the time difference calculation (as needed for the topocentric term of the time conversion). Also, the first input argument may be TDB or TT and the difference between the two is neglected in the internal calculations (TDB is formally required). These simplifications make this function unsuitable for moderately high precision applications.
ttOrTdbSinceJ2000
TDB or TT in seconds since J2000.
stationLongitude
Longitude of point on Earth where difference is to be calculated
distanceFromSpinAxis
Distance from Earth spin axis where difference is to be calculated
distanceFromEquatorialPlane
Distance from Earth equatorial plane where difference is to be calculated
Difference between TDB and TT at requested position and TDB

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate difference between TDB and TT.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate difference between TDB (Dynamical Barycentric Time) and TT (Terrestrial Time), from Sofa function, which is based on decomposition of time ephemeris generated by Fairhead an Bretagnon (1990). This function uses a simplification for the input to the algorithm: it is assumed that UTC and UT1 coincide for the purposes of the time difference calculation (as needed for the topocentric term of the time conversion). Also, the first input argument may be TDB or TT and the difference between the two is neglected in the internal calculations (TDB is formally required). These simplifications make this function unsuitable for moderately high precision applications.
ttOrTdbSinceJ2000
TDB or TT in seconds since J2000.
stationCartesianPosition
Earth-fixed Cartesian position of evaluation point
Difference between TDB and TT at requested position and TDB
